meanings.definition: A covered litter for one passenger, consisting of a large box carried on two horizontal poles by four or six bearers.
meanings.sent1: The palanquins gently swayed as they carried the nobleman through the streets.
meanings.sent2: The tourists enjoyed a ride in the palanquins during their visit to the historic city.
meanings.sent3: The palanquins looked like cozy little cabins on the move.
meanings.sent4: The palanquins floated through the crowd like royal thrones on the shoulders of the bearers.
meanings.sent5: The palanquins, with their curtains drawn, offered a sense of privacy amidst the bustling city.

meanings.definition: A similar litter for the transport of goods, consisting of a platform or tray carried in the same way.
meanings.sent1: The market vendors used palanquins to transport their fresh produce to the town square.
meanings.sent2: The workers loaded the heavy crates onto the palanquins for delivery to the warehouse.
meanings.sent3: The palanquins were like sturdy tables on the move, carrying goods with ease.
meanings.sent4: The palanquins bore the weight of the cargo like loyal pack animals.
meanings.sent5: The palanquins, stacked high with goods, trundled along the bumpy road towards their destination.
